title: 104_hr318
content: Priority of claims for retiree health benefits. The definition of "retiree health benefits" is clarified as payments for medical care for retired employees and their dependents under a plan established by the debtor before filing for bankruptcy. Redesignating paragraphs (21A) through (47) as paragraphs (22) through (51), respectively, amending Section 726(a)(1) of title 11, United States Code to prioritize payment of claims specified in section 507 before retiree health benefits claims. Section 724(b)(2) of title 11, United States Code is amended to include holders of claims for retiree health benefits. Section 1129(a) of title 11, United States Code is also amended to prioritize payment of claims before retiree health benefits claims. The amendment to Section 724(b)(2) of title 11, United States Code includes holders of claims for retiree health benefits in the liquidation plan. If liquidation is proposed, a class of claims for retiree health benefits will receive deferred cash payments or immediate cash equal to the allowed aggregate amount of such claims. The amendment to Section 724(b)(2) of title 11, United States Code includes holders of claims for retiree health benefits in the liquidation plan. The plan provides for the continuation of payment of retiree benefits at the established level until confirmation of the plan, and for liquidation, it provides for deferred or immediate cash payments for claims related to retiree health benefits. The amendment includes provisions for the payment of allowed unsecured claims for retiree health benefits in the liquidation plan, limited to $10,000 multiplied by the number of former employees with retiree health benefits. The amendments made by this Act do not limit any priority claims for retiree health benefits under title 11 of the United States Code. SEC. 3 of the Act specifies the effective dates and application of amendments. The Act and its amendments will take effect upon enactment, with certain provisions applying to cases under title 11 of the United States Code after specific dates.
